headline: Seeking Pancho Villa
summary: In life, Pancho Villa was a bandit, a general, a folk hero. In short, he embodied the Mexican Revolution. In death, however, his body is a tricky one to find, rumored to be in many places.

summary: Cablevision, Time Warner and Comcast have agreed to allow their broadband Internet subscribers to roam freely across the Wi-Fi deployments of all three major cable operators in the New York metro area.

summary: The door is closing on the old order as the prospects for negotiation dim.

summary: Congress a near six-week extension of federal jobless benefits in a $18.2 billion bill that also continues health insurance subsidies for unemployed people. Obama signed the bill into law late Thursday night.

summary: Microsoft said it is investigating allegations of worker abuse at a factory in China that makes computer mice, cameras and other devices for the technology giant.

headline: The Met Bets on Picasso
summary: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is banking on a big name for its feature exhibition this spring—Pablo Picasso. The museum will be displaying some 300 works that are all drawn from its own collection, with paintings, drawings and sculptures that encompass the artist's long and influential career. "Picasso in The Metropolitan Museum of Art" will be on view from April 27 until August 1.

headline: Program Trading

headline: A Healthy U.S. Is Still Key to the World's Economy

In his view, the collapse of global equity markets 18 months ago was a panic triggered by a credit-market seizure. He thinks that the setback will turn out to have been a hiccup in a long-term upward repricing of stocks to properly reflect global opportunities.
